name: Ian Cooper
description: '''Ian Cooper''' (born 14 August 1970) is an Australian violinist. He was commissioned to compose and perform the [[The Games of the XXVII Olympiad 2000: Music from the Opening Ceremony|"Tin Symphony"]] for the opening ceremony of the [[2000 Summer Olympics opening ceremony|Games of the XXVII Olympiad]] in Sydney. The event was televised worldwide with an estimated 2.85 billion viewers. He performs many musical styles including [[Classical music|classical]], [[Gypsy style|gypsy]], [[Jazz violin|jazz]], [[Irish fiddle|Irish]] and [[country music]] and has appeared with [[Tommy Emmanuel]], [[James Morrison (musician)|James Morrison]], [[Olivia Newton-John]], [[Barry White]], [[Simon Tedeschi]], [[Deni Hines]], and [[Freak Show (album)|Silverchair]].
